title: Sheffield United vs Liverpool prediction: How will Premier League game play out?
text:
Sheffield United welcome early Premier League pace-setters Liverpool to Bramall Lane looking to end the visitors’ winning start.

The Blades exited the Carabao Cup in midweek, but have started the season strongly, and find themselves in the top half of the table after six games.

Liverpool were able to rotate and progress through to the next round of the cup, but it is expected to be business as usual, with Jurgen Klopp bringing his big guns back in.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Five points is a large margin at this juncture, but with Manchester City seemingly back to their rampant best, Klopp’s side cannot afford a misstep in the Steel City.

Here’s everything you need to know about the game:

Prediction

Liverpool should have too much quality for Sheffield United, but do not write off the Blades – they will take heart from Norwich’s win over Manchester City and seek a similar shock.

Yet it is hard to see the depleted forward line troubling Liverpool’s secure defence in the same manner, and thus we are predicting a 3-1 Liverpool win.

Odds

Sheffield United: 17/2

Draw: 4/1

Liverpool: 1/3

Team News

Liverpool remain without Alisson, though the Brazilian is not too far away from a return, and could train this weekend.

Xherdan Shaqiri has been ruled out, but James Milner should be fit after scoring in the Carabao Cup.

Talismanic striker Billy Sharp completes his suspension for Sheffield United, who may be further depleted in forward areas by the absence of David McGoldrick, who is a major injury doubt.

Predicted Line-ups

Sheffield United: Henderson; Basham, Egan, O’Connell; Baldock, Lundstram, Norwood, Fleck, Stevens; McBurnie, Robinson

Liverpool: Adrian; Alexander-Arnold, Matip, Van Dijk, Robertson; Henderson, Fabinho, Wijnaldum; Salah, Firmino, Mane

What time does it kick-off?

Sheffield United vs Liverpool begins at 12.30pm BST.

What channel is it on?

The game will be broadcast live on BT Sport 1, with their coverage beginning at midday.

Can I live stream the game?

Subscribers to BT Sport can watch the game via the BT Sport app or via a web browser.
description: Sheffield United welcome early Premier League pace-setters Liverpool to Bramall Lane looking to end the visitors’ winning start. The Blades exited the Carabao Cup in midweek, but have started the season strongly, and find themselves in the top half of the table after six games.
